subject: Nutrition
title: K-Rations and Military Nutrition
description: Learn K-Rations and Military Nutrition in one minute.

hook.text: American WWII soldiers got 3,000 calories a day from a pack smaller than a shoebox.

buildup.text: K-rations were designed by Ancel Keys to be compact, calorie-dense, and nutritionally complete.

discovery.text: Each ration included canned meat, biscuits, candy, coffee, and cigarettesâ€”yes, cigarettes counted as morale.

twist.text: Soldiers hated them. The food was monotonous, leading to widespread undereating in the field.

climax.text: K-rations proved that nutrition isn't just nutrientsâ€”palatability and variety matter for actual consumption.

punchline.text: Calories only count if soldiers actually eat them.
